verses.verse: (Praise and Thanksgiving) To the leader. Of David. A Psalm. A Song. (Num 10.35; Isa 33.3) Let God rise up; let his enemies be scattered; let those who hate him flee before him.
(Ps 97.5; Isa 9.18; Hos 13.3; Mic 1.4) As smoke is driven away, so drive them away; as wax melts before the fire, let the wicked perish before God.
(Ps 32.11) But let the righteous be joyful; let them exult before God; let them be jubilant with joy.

(Ps 66.2; 83.18; Isa 40.3; 57.14) Sing to God; sing praises to his name; lift up a song to him who rides upon the clouds (Or cast up a highway for him who rides through the deserts) — his name is the LORD— be exultant before him.
(Deut 10.18; 26.15; Ps 146.9) Father of orphans and protector of widows is God in his holy habitation.
(Ps 107.34; 113.9; Acts 12.6) God gives the desolate a home to live in; he leads out the prisoners to prosperity, but the rebellious live in a parched land.
(Ex 13.21; Judg 4.14) O God, when you went out before your people, when you marched through the wilderness, Selah
(Ex 19.16, 18; Judg 5.4) the earth quaked, the heavens poured down rain at the presence of God, the God of Sinai, at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
(Deut 11.11) Rain in abundance, O God, you showered abroad; you restored your heritage when it languished;
(Deut 26.5; Ps 74.19) your flock found a dwelling in it; in your goodness, O God, you provided for the needy.
The Lord gives the command; great is the company of those (Or company of the women) who bore the tidings:
(1 Sam 30.24; Ps 135.11) “The kings of the armies, they flee, they flee!” The women at home divide the spoil,
(Gen 49.14) though they stay among the sheepfolds— the wings of a dove covered with silver, its pinions with green gold.
(Josh 10.10) When the Almighty (Traditional rendering of Heb Shaddai) scattered kings there, snow fell on Zalmon.
O mighty mountain, mountain of Bashan; O many-peaked mountain, mountain of Bashan!
(Deut 12.5; Ps 87.1, 2) Why do you look with envy, O many-peaked mountain, at the mount that God desired for his abode, where the LORD will reside forever?
(Deut 33.2; Dan 7.10) With mighty chariotry, twice ten thousand, thousands upon thousands, the Lord came from Sinai into the holy place. (Cn: Heb The Lord among them Sinai in the holy (place))
(Judg 5.12; Acts 1.9; Eph 4.8; 1 Tim 1.13) You ascended the high mount, leading captives in your train and receiving gifts from people, even from those who rebel against the LORD God’s abiding there.
(Ps 55.22; 65.5) Blessed be the Lord, who daily bears us up; God is our salvation. Selah
(Ps 49.15; 56.13) Our God is a God of salvation, and to GOD, the Lord, belongs escape from death.
(Ps 55.23; 110.6) But God will shatter the heads of his enemies, the hairy crown of those who walk in their guilty ways.
(Ex 14.22; Num 21.33) The Lord said, “I will bring them back from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea,
(1 Kings 21.9; Ps 58.10) so that you may bathe (Gk Syr Tg: Heb shatter) your feet in blood, so that the tongues of your dogs may have their share from the foe.”
(Ps 63.2; 77.13) Your solemn processions are seen, (Or have been seen) O God, the processions of my God, my King, into the sanctuary—
(Judg 11.34; 1 Chr 13.8) the singers in front, the musicians last, between them young women playing tambourines:
(Deut 33.28; Ps 26.12; Isa 48.1) “Bless God in the great congregation, the LORD, O you who are of Israel’s fountain!”
(1 Sam 9.21) There is Benjamin, the least of them, in the lead, the princes of Judah in a body, the princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.
Summon your might, O God; show your strength, O God, as you have done for us before.
(Ps 72.10) Because of your temple at Jerusalem, kings bear gifts to you.

(Ps 22.12; 89.10) Rebuke the wild animals that live among the reeds, the herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples. Trample (Cn: Heb Trampling) under foot those who lust after tribute; scatter the peoples who delight in war. (Meaning of Heb of 68.30 is uncertain)
(Isa 19.19; 45.14) Let bronze be brought from Egypt; let Cush hasten to stretch out its hands to God.
Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth; sing praises to the Lord, Selah
(Deut 10.14; Ps 18.10; 29.4; 46.6) O rider in the heavens, the ancient heavens; listen, he sends out his voice, his mighty voice.
(Ps 29.1) Ascribe power to God, whose majesty is over Israel and whose power is in the skies.
(Ps 29.11; 47.2; 66.20) Awesome is God in his (Gk: Heb from your) sanctuary, the God of Israel; he gives power and strength to his people. Blessed be God!
